---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]

nodes.body: For a less bulky PR I split off the pointwise convergence topology into #11496

:v: mcdoll can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Just coming by to say thanks for this work! In particular I'm happy that we're not emphasizing the "strong topology" name, which could have been confusing (have you considered renaming the file? That can wait for a later PR of course).

bors merge
Yes, the name is far from perfect, but I am not too keen on doing renaming PRs, they tend to have a very poor time to usefulness ratio.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Sorry for the delay in review. Looks good!

bors d+

Sorry for the delay in review. Looks good!

bors d+

```suggestion
instance funLike [TopologicalSpace F] [TopologicalAddGroup F]
    ( : Set (Set E)) : FunLike (UniformConvergenceCLM  F ) E F := 
  ContinuousLinearMap.funLike

instance continuousSemilinearMapClass [TopologicalSpace F] [TopologicalAddGroup F]
    ( : Set (Set E)) : ContinuousSemilinearMapClass (UniformConvergenceCLM  F )  E F :=
  ContinuousLinearMap.continuousSemilinearMapClass
```

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ( : Set (Set E)) : FunLike (UniformConvergenceCLM F ) E F := ```

I think this is okay now, no?
```suggestion
instance t2Space [TopologicalSpace F] [TopologicalAddGroup F] [T2Space F]
```
I think that doesn't ever fire, because in every concrete case we still have to show `  = Set.univ` and together with that proof we want to have an instance.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/Algebra/StrongTopology): introduce type synonym for abstract topologies on CLM
